paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variant information and penetrance data from a study on postmenopausal breast cancer patients.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among 49 postmenopausal unrelated women, 5 (10.2%) were identified to harbor mutations of clinical significance, 3 in BRCA1 and 2 in BRCA2.
Among 49 postmenopausal unrelated women, 5 (10.2%) were identified to harbor mutations of clinical significance, 3 in BRCA1 and 2 in BRCA2.

functional_data.summary: The mutations were identified through next-generation sequencing and Sanger sequencing.

variants.segregation_data: All five BRCA mutations were identified among 47 patients who reported a positive family history of breast, ovarian, prostate, and pancreatic cancers.
variants.additional_notes: The presence of CHEK2 c.1100delC mutation was investigated in 47 out of the 49 patients; however, no mutations were detected.
key_quotes: Among 49 postmenopausal unrelated women, 5 (10.2%) were identified to harbor mutations of clinical significance, 3 in BRCA1 and 2 in BRCA2.

tables_processed.table_caption: BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations identified in postmenopausal breast cancer patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
